answers.author: Toni Cramer
answers.text:
See attached policy.  We provide city issued phones for some and stipends for others.  Departments make the business decision about who needs a phone and whether it should be city issued and part of a pool of minutes or stipend.  And whether it is cell only or data only or both.  Employee-owned phones must meet operational and security standards established by IT to connect to the network and exchange.

answers.author: Sandra Findley
answers.text:
We appreciate the responses to date.  We were/are considering providing a varied subsidy to all employees required to carry a cell phone based on departmental indentified need (phone, data, etc).  Our big stumbling block is that our cell provider will require credit checks and all employees required to carry a phone will not pass the check.  The information provided gives us alternatives to look at.

answers.author: Karen Windon
answers.text:
We have provided cell phone allowances for about 5 years. There are still some 'pool' phones for on call positions, but the majority are under the allowance. This has worked well to allow staff to carry a single phone for both personal and professional use and to allow them to use the technology that best suits their needs.

answers.author: Dave Beck
answers.text:
These are all very helpful and serve as a valuable resource while we explore alternatives to current cell/smart phone practices.  For your information, the following is a link to the IRS website concerning tax treatment of personal use of business cell phones, with recommendations for provisions to be included in policies:  http://www.irs.gov/taxpros/article/0,,id=214446,00.html
Subparagraph G applies to cell phones and a recommendation for a moratorium on the enforcement of IRC Section 2747(d)(4) pertaining to cell phones.

author: Tracy Miller
text:
A Florida government is interested if you are considering providing cell phone allowances (ie. $75 a month) as opposed to issuing a device.  If you have experience with this or are contemplating this action or have a formal policies to share that address these choices, please provide those as well.  Additionally, have you given consideration to which staff are issued a cell phone for instance a field worker vs. someone who needs a data plan would you give them an allowance and let them get what they want?  Respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Cell Phone Allowances vs. Issuing Cell Phones
